sense.name: increase, supplement, enhance, constitute an addition
sense.commentary: NOTE: Throughout this task, please beware of adjectival usages, such as "added value"(adj+noun)--but note that "added value" may also be a verb+object (sense 3). Please decide carefully, and tag "X" for adjectives. NOTE: Compare carefully to sense 2; in this sense, a unit is given to an entity, a portion is given to a total. In sense 2, parts 1 and 2 are combined to create the entity. Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] ADD (NP2[theme]) (PP{to NP3[target]}) In stocks: NP1[financial institution] ADD NP2[numerical value] to NP3[total worth]
sense.examples: She added a personal note to her letter. He spoke at length, paused to see our reaction, then added 'I guess that's all'. We are going to add a new sun deck to our house. I think adding salt would bring out the flavor of this dish. We figured, since we're in Europe, let's add on a week on our own dime. Computer company ABC added 3/8 to 31 5/8. The dark colors in that painting add to the overall somber feeling. Salt added to the intense flavor of that dish. This adds a light note to the program. This paper will add to her reputation. Live piano jazz as well as selected background music adds to the experience.

sense.name: total, calculate, form an entity
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare carefully to sense 1; this sense refers to combining elements to create a total Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] ADD NP2 and NP3 NP1,2,...n [entities] ADD UP (may be used metaphorically)
sense.examples: Please add 12 and 74. When I added the bill up, it seemed too high. The facts in that case just don't add up.
